headline: Amazon Launches Infrastructure Region in New Zealand
summary: SEATTLE, September 01, 2025--Amazon (NASDAQ: AMZN) today announced the launch of the AWS Asia Pacific (New Zealand) Region. The new AWS Region will give developers, startups, entrepreneurs, and enterprises, as well as financial services, retail, education, government, and nonprofit organizations, greater choice for running their applications and serving end users from data centers located in New Zealand. As part of its long-term commitment, Amazon is planning to invest more than NZ$7.5 billion i

headline: Oaktree Capital Co-Founder Says We're in the 'Early Days' of a Market Bubble—Here's His Defense Strategy for the Storm Ahead
summary: Oaktree Capital Management LP co-founder Howard Marks is sounding a cautionary note on today’s market, drawing parallels to the late 1990s tech boom while offering investors a roadmap for navigating what he believes are the early stages of another bubble. Speaking on Bloomberg Television on Aug. 20, the legendary investor painted a picture of a market where stocks have become “expensive relative to fundamentals or reality,” driven by psychological forces where investors increasingly “like stocks

headline: Abu Dhabi-backed G42 aims to diversify chip suppliers for AI campus, Semafor reports
summary: The group is still negotiating with major American technology firms including Amazon's AWS cloud, Microsoft, Meta and Elon Musk's xAI to become tenants at the data center, with Google being the furthest along in negotiations, according to the report.  G42 is looking to chipmakers AMD, Cerebras Systems and Qualcomm to supply some of the computing capacity at the campus, the report said.  The campus was announced during U.S. President Donald Trump's visit to the Emirates in May when he announced deals with the Gulf state totaling over $200 billion.

headline: ‘People say London’s expensive but I pay £1,100 a month and get a pool and cinema’
summary: I’ve been living in London for three years now, and contrary to what you may think, it’s not too expensive if you know the right places. I’m planning on living here for a couple more years, but I wouldn’t start a family in the capital because of the unaffordable house prices.

headline: This Giant German Tech Stock Can Run With the Mag 7. The Case to Buy in.
summary: The U.S. has the Magnificent Seven, but Europe has “der Eine,” or the One—German software provider  SAP  After an earnings-related pullback, the stock now looks like it’s worth buying.  In fact, SAP is the only stock that deserves mention with the great U.S. tech companies, whether Microsoft and the rest of the  or smaller ones like Oracle and Salesforce.  Although nothing was obviously wrong with them, the results still triggered a 10% pullback since then as investors fretted about the impact of a weakening dollar and a miss on cloud revenue growth.
